Ozymandias
Unknown
By default, Haskell uses lazy evaluation; it performs computations only when it needs to. This may seem like wasteful procrastination, but it's actually a deliberate effort towards optimization.
Unknown
fib1.hs
Unknown
#!/usr/bin/env runhaskell fib :: Int -> Int fib 0 = 0 fib 1 = 1 fib n = fib (n - 1) + fib (n - 2) main :: IO () main = do putStrLn (show (fib 30))
Unknown
Example
Unknown
$ time ./fib1.hs 832040 12.11 real 1.92 user 0.21 sys
Unknown
Although calculating fib 30 is rather intensive, this program can be made to run quickly by memoizing the results of previous calls. If Haskell knows that fib 28 is 317811, it doesn't need to recalculate this when calling fib 29.
Unknown
fib2.hs
Unknown
#!/usr/bin/env runhaskell import Data.MemoTrie (memo) fib :: Int -> Int fib = memo fib' where fib' :: Int -> Int fib' 0 = 0 fib' 1 = 1 fib' n = fib' (n - 1) + fib' (n - 2) main :: IO () main = do putStrLn (show (fib 30))
Unknown
Example
Unknown
$ time ./fib2.hs 832040 2.56 real 1.94 user 0.06 sys
Unknown
This time, the function calls are memoized, by using a built-in Haskell library, MemoTrie. The ordinary, unmemoized function has been renamed fib', pronounced "fib prime". And this function is exposed to the user as fib, a memoized version of it. It is not surprising that the function has been sped up by memoization: any programming language can implement a memoized version of a function. What is surprising is that in Haskell this can be accomplished by calling the desired function with memo func, which automatically figures out how to memoize the function. This is achieved in Haskell by, once again, its incredibly expressive yet robust type system, which uses mathematical objects called GADTs: generalized algebraic datatypes. Once memoized, Haskell does not actually call the function several hundred times, because it already knows the answer.
Unknown
Another use of lazy evaluation is infinite data structures.

Type-Safe
Unknown
When life gives you lemons, you clone those lemons and make SUPER lemons.
Unknown
Scudworth
Unknown
Haskell is strictly typed: every expression has a type, determined at compile time. The variable x cannot be an integer one minute and a string the next. This is also known as type-safety. As with lazy evaluation, it's a blessing in disguise. Type safety increases robustness without sacrificing flexibility. Haskell does this with algebraic data types, pattern matching, type inference, and type classes.
Unknown
The example programs so far explicitly state the types of the expressions involved. In the Goodbye World program, the greeting is a String formed by concatenating two other Strings, and main is an action, IO, returning (). If main were expected to return the greeting after printing it, main would have the type IO String.
Unknown
goodbye.hs (explicit types)
Unknown
#!/usr/bin/env runhaskell greeting :: String greeting = "Goodbye " ++ "World!" main :: IO () main = do putStrLn greeting
Unknown
Haskell can intelligently determine many types automatically. This is known as type inference. If the type signatures are omitted, the program will still compile and run as before.
Unknown
goodbye.hs (no type signatures)
Unknown
#!/usr/bin/env runhaskell greeting = "Goodbye " ++ "World!" main = do putStrLn greeting
Unknown
Example
Unknown
$ runhaskell goodbye.hs Goodbye World!
Unknown
Pattern matching works well with type-safety, as used in the Fibonacci program. The fibfunction is defined by three patterns. The first two patterns, fib 0 and fib 1, are base cases. The last pattern, fib n is the general recursive case; it is used whenever fib is applied to a value that is not 0 or 1. Because fib n is monotonically decreasing by one, the recursive calls will always reduce to one of the two base case patterns, eventually returning a single value. The absence of edge cases for a given algorithm can be proven rigorously using Coq, an automated proof assistant cousin to Haskell and other ML's.
Unknown
fib.hs (minimal)
Unknown
#!/usr/bin/env runhaskell fib :: Int -> Int fib 0 = 0 fib 1 = 1 fib n = fib (n - 1) + fib (n - 2) main :: IO () main = do putStrLn (show (fib 30))
Unknown
It would be redundant to add new patterns, but they could aid in memoization.

Target the Reavers. Target the Reavers! Target everyone! Somebody fire!
Unknown
Operative
Unknown
The closest thing Haskell has to objects is records. Records encapsulate data in a form more manipulable than objects, but records do not include methods. Data transformations naturally flow from the data types; they are already semantically bundled and there is no need to labor the point by using object.method() syntax when function recordwill do. This is how Haskell can get by just fine without requiring Object Oriented Programming, because Haskell's type system informs the programmer how the data can be treated, and informs the compiler at a low level how the data must be treated.
Unknown
laser.hs
Unknown
#!/usr/bin/env runhaskell data Target = Fool String | Crowd Integer | TheMoon deriving (Eq, Ord, Show) fireOn :: Target -> String fireOn (Fool s) = s ++ " blasted!" fireOn (Crowd n) = show n ++ "'s murdered!" fireOn TheMoon = "How did you miss a shot like that?"
Unknown
Example
Unknown
$ ghci Prelude> :load laser.hs [1 of 1] Compiling Main ( laser.hs, interpreted ) Ok, modules loaded: Main. *Main> fireOn (Fool "Jerry") "Jerry blasted!" *Main> fireOn (Crowd 100) "100's murdered!" *Main> fireOn TheMoon "How did you miss a shot like that?"
Unknown
The laser program declares a data type Targetwith three constructors. A target is either a Fool String, a Crowd Integer, or TheMoon. Pattern matching in the fireOn function is used to unpack the target and determine which of the three constructors was used. Then fireOn acts on the specific constructor, blasting fools, murdering crowds, and somehow missing the moon.
Unknown
No matter which constructor was used, Haskell derives how to compare two targets for equivalence, how to order targets in a list, and how to transform targets into strings for printing.
Unknown
*Main> :m + Data.List *Main Data.List> sort [Crowd 50, Crowd 40, TheMoon, Crowd 60, Fool "Ava"] [Fool "Ava",Crowd 40,Crowd 50,Crowd 60,TheMoon]
Unknown
Fools come before Crowds come before TheMoon in laser striking priority. In other languages, one would have to write custom compareTo and toString functions. In Haskell, deriving (Eq, Ord, Show) automatically generates basic functionality for any given data type.
Unknown
Functions can be composed together and used as arguments for other functions.
Unknown
*Main Data.List> let shout = unwords . take 2 . words . fireOn *Main Data.List> shout TheMoon "How did"
Unknown
Robust
Unknown
Haskell refuses to fireOn anything but Fools, Crowds, and TheMoon, because the function is only defined for these. Haskell will not compile code that attempts to fireOn Henchmen or MeeMaw, because these are not valid targets. Furthermore, for any valid target, Haskell will always faithfully fireOn the target, because Haskell has no null. Every expression is of a certain type and can never change type. As seen in the laser program, this by no means limits Haskell's expressiveness, nor does it encumber the programmer. Type-safety increases clarity, robustness, and flexibility, affording the evil genius more time for plotting the demise of his foes.

尽管AI一词最初就是用于表达与人类智能相似的机器智能的含义，但在人工智能跌宕起伏的发展过程中，AI的内涵已经发生了变化，成为机器学习、统计分析的代名词，早已远离了一开始智能的初衷。在这种情况下，依旧坚守当年梦想的一小支学术分子共同成立了通用人工智能协会，并确定使用AGI词条作为领域正规称谓￼。
Unknown
开发者的话
Unknown
如果不给人选择的权利，人便不能称为人。像最近的alphago，gpt-2等等深度模型，并不能称为真正的人工智能。人可以任意修改下棋的规则，由着自己的心情选择下与不下，甚至还可以做白日梦，联想到其他的事情。同样的，人写文章时可能会烦躁，可以写到一半开始画画，也可以直接放弃写作。机器模型在这方面相形见绌。
Unknown
开发的方法​​​
Unknown
​AGI的开发方法很简单。人的思想是因教育而来，可以理解为成千上万的微小程序实时决策，从而构成了人的意识。与编程语言相对应，语言文字是对人脑的编程，不能放弃，就像西医和中医一样，互为辅佐。目前的电脑可以处理编程语言构成的程序，实现报错，存储，计算，反馈等等操作。但是要想真正实现AGI，就一定要把人脑编程的核心语言:自然语言搞懂。
Unknown
幼师的工作是繁重的，也是不可避免的。人类循环积累的知识，不传给下一代，就会完全消失。而这个传授的过程是由浅入深，由下至上的金字塔结构。我们不可避免的承认，人的适应力相当强，只要一个人有对某事物的强烈兴趣，那么搞懂它不会太难。这种自发式的学习，一定是建立在对自己的基础程序有充分信任的前提下。比如能看清图案，能听清语音，能记住线索。如何找出这些被信任的基础技能，并让电脑自行运作，是实现AGI的关键。
Unknown
​​人从他人身上习得情绪​​​​​
Unknown
很多小孩不知道如何做出厌恶的表情，也不知道如何做国际交友手势。这说明很有可能情绪是后天逐渐习得的。现实可能是这样：先学到生活环境中经常出现的情绪，比如父母常年吵架，那么小孩很快学会如何生气吵架；后面自主学习能力变强，寻找那些稍纵即逝的情感，比如从某本讲解人类表情的书内了解到如何表达厌恶。
Unknown
人类的本质是复读机，而复读的方式却是随机。那么我们想要制作的AGI便是与人一样的一个矛盾共同体，既要求同又要存异，既要有时像单摆一样单调无趣，又要有时像混沌双摆一样变幻无常。
Unknown
开发人的心理
Unknown
根据Industry Society and Its Future这篇论文所预测的那样，信息科学是最有潜力，最有可能实现全人类物质自由和精神自由的方向，也是最有可能毁灭人类的方向。有人担心AGI叛变，有人担心用技术作恶，可是对于一个真正想做出AGI的人，不应当去思考以上的问题。就像人只要学到足够的知识，具备足够的条件便能大显身手，电脑有足够强大的条件也可以大显身手。这是显而易见的真理，毋庸置疑，不因任何人的立场和态度发生任何变化。AGI的开发应当理解为对智能的一场朝圣，而且是相当朴素的。所有对AGI的探讨，都应当回归本源：人是如何变得智能的，电脑是如何发展的等等。
Unknown
对于未来的担心是没有必要的，因为这是人类的宿命，不论是按下快进键，暂停键，还是倒带键，都不可能改变它。开发者需要做的，便是带动越来越多的机械和人力投入这场AGI开发热潮，毕竟长痛不如短痛，越快度过这次危机，人类的未来才会越光明。
Unknown

The Lazero Platform:
It includes two versions, but it can be hybrid. Below are just some concepts when the entire platform running in auto mode, which is its default mode. There is no so-called manual mode, because the default mode is simply embedded and cannot be overridden.
Software version:
Install standalone software to an internet connected device, such as windows PC, mac, Android, linux. The port will be open for further adjustments. It will monitor traffic over mouse, keyboard, display, learn from local data and web. Dynamic storage distribution. Execute shell commands and create native ports.
Hardware version:
Connect the machine via usb, internet cable, thunderbolt, hdmi and more. Unification of identification. Android devices can be controlled via wireless usb, or just web. All data will be stored into the lazero brick, if set. Same functionality, but the brick itself might have different versions. The heavy duty version might use x86 processors, HDD and multiports. The mobile version is completely wireless, storage using SSD or sd card, only have one external charging interface, and use standard rechargable, replacable batteries.
Hybrid version:
You can set this by configure one device installed with lazero software to hybrid. Once set, data will share between this device and the brick. Master-slave mode is not applied, since it depends on the computational capability to determine this in real-time. Also one can use lazero brick without preinstallation of software lazero on the device, but the hardware controller might have the need to do so. These settings will self-change if there is need to change.

<service android:name=".MyAccessibilityService">
